page.title: 07Stagsden History.
page.content: There were 2 shops in the village,a bakery and a butchers shop and 3 pubs- the White Horse and the Dog and Duck are gone, but the Royal George remains today.Milk was fetched from Manor Farm by older children before they went to school.The school had up to 100 children on roll as families often 7-12 children.There was a wheelwrights business,an undertaker,farrier,clock repairer,and sawpit.Today only the blacksmith remains carrying out wrought ironwork and machinery repairs but no farriery.The village also had its own Brass Band.
